website_summaries.verdict: This highly-rated, professional-grade filament is sure to impress businesses and creative individuals alike.
pros: Can be purchased in 2, 5, or 20 lbs
Compatible with a number of 3D printers
Customers rave over the filament's silky smooth outcome
cons: A little expensive when compared to other filaments

customer_reviews.title: First layer doesn't stick well and lamination is not good. I tried different temperatures (up to 240c) but ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work well for me (using Flashforge Creator Pro with PEI bed). First layer doesn't stick well and lamination is not good. I tried different temperatures (up to 240c) but still not good. I had better success with other non black filaments from Hatchbox and IC3D. I recently gravitate more and more to Hatchbox ABS filaments, better price and so far they all gave me very good printing results. Edit: added a picture with sample prints with Hatchbox yellow, IC3D red, IC3D blue and IC3D black (the subject of my review). The IC3D black I got underperforms consistently, except for very simple models.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Joe

customer_reviews.title: Legit ABS!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big 3D Fuel fan but they didn't have 1.75 ABS in stock. Looked online and these guys showed uo. Watched a ton of videos and reviews. So i got it. I built a Ikea laka case for my ender 3. Glass bed Stiffer bed springs Billet filament fedder My ender 3 settings No fan for cooling 240c nozzel 90c bed Basic cura settings Glue stick the bed works amazing This material does have an odor but works very well and will not warp once you have your settings down. A control temp invorment os much needed for this material. Hope this helps. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: The Pest

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, extra bad smell
customer_reviews.text: I printed thousands and thousands of tiny pieces using this material. It warped a lot. It popped off the bed a lot. It drooped and sagged and globbed a lot. But it probably isn't the material's fault. All ABS is like that. This had a particularly noxious scent to it, like snorting cancer.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Bed adhesion is fantastic, corners are sharp
customer_reviews.text: Been holding back on ABS printing and focused purely on PLA printing because I assumed its an easier filament to use. However, the results I'm getting with the IC3D Black ABS is simply astonishing. Bed adhesion is fantastic, corners are sharp, layering is outstanding, and this stuff is strong and not at all temperamental like some of my PLA! Printing on a Prusa i3 MK3 with hot end @ 260/255 Celcius and bed at 100/110 Celcius. Increased extrusion rate by 5% (1.05).
customer_reviews.author: Woodchuck

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Packaged nicely. It's always good to receive a roll of filament with the vacuum seal intact. This is consistent in color and size but is still not the red I was looking for. They tend to be either a tick or two toward orange or pink. Of all the reds I have used, (I have 6 different brands of red in my containers) the overpriced and lesser quality XYZPrinting red is hands down my favorite. I wish a better brand would have a red of their tone. Anyway, this is great ABS and should suit the 'red' needs of 99% of makers.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA / Great Color and Texture / Good Adhesion and Strength
customer_reviews.text: This filament extruded with no fails throughout the entire spool. Being made in the USA, this filament has gone through less transportation time and I believe this greatly effects the quality of the filament as there is less time for atmospheric effects on the plastic filament. The layer adhesion was good, and I found the extrusion to be best at around 240 degrees Celsius and a bed temperature of 115 degrees Celsius. This filament does have a shrinkage effect (as does all ABS filament) of roughly 5%, so that is something to keep in mind while printing. Overall, this filament met project requirements and expectations. I would purchase again when in need of filament.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Corn

customer_reviews.title: Pass, doesn’t stick.
customer_reviews.text: I thought to be nice and support an American company making filament, however this material was a huge headache because it didn’t stick, unless I slurried the heck out of the build plate. Other Chinese materials had 0 problem with adhesion and warping.
customer_reviews.author: CircuitMasterAtGmail

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Worst filament I've had thus far in the past 3 years of printing. Jams my printer within 15 minutes of printing. Diameter of filament jumps from 1.45 all the way to 2.15mm no 2 feet of this filament are the same diameter. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aislyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Best budget filament
customer_reviews.text: Awesome filament for the price. No fillers. No popping which means it does not absorb moisture. Don’t bother buying cheap filament, spend a whopping 5$ more and get this. It’s still cheap and the quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen E. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this filament
customer_reviews.text: Up till now I've mainly printed in PLA. ABS has been so hit and miss for me. I decided to try a more expensive domestic ABS to see if there was really a difference. I'm only about 1/3 of the way through my first spool but if it keeps being this excellent at printing I'll be buying more. I've had very good bonding to the bed and zero delamination on the parts. Even problematic prints are printing better than the cheap no name brands I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Using the IC3D on Makerbot Replicator 2X
customer_reviews.text: I loaded the IC3D Black ABS filament spool on our Makerbot Replicator 2X. The filament is good quality, the parts I printed so far with it have worked/looked great. One thing to mention is that the standard spool holder is not big enough for this spool. You need at least 4" on the spool holder to support this spool. Downloaded a longer/stronger spool holder from Thingiverse that is doing a good job. Filament is great, and it's awesome to not have to worry about running out anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Top quality / Amazing Price
customer_reviews.text: I have a small 3D printing business on Etsy called 3D Printing Egg. I purchase a lot of filament on Amazon due not having a general supplier of materials. So I look at price and quallty. There are lots of cheaper filaments online, but when I factor in the time it takes to clear off jams and to reprint failed or flawed products, it is costly. That is why I love IC3D filament. The price is perfect and the quality is second to none. Wish it was available all the time for 2 day shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: My favorite is there PLA
customer_reviews.text: I have been using IC3D filament for my 3D printing business sense day one and I hardly every have problems printing on my Flashforge Creator Pro. I only use there Black ABS & PLA right now and do plan to try out there other colors soon! I have so many stickers from there boxes I think I can make a wall of IC3D right now! My favorite is there PLA, I can print so fast with such high quality and I love the shine! Keep up the good work and fast delivery every time I don't realize I'm low and have to order next day!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Large format printing
customer_reviews.text: When you print small parts you can get away with a lot of slop. As you scale up, things get tricky exponentially. You have to control a lot more variables. To get large well-bonded parts of another dimension. I've ran a few kg of this stuff through a 5,000 cubic inch machine. No problems. None. That is a statement in itself to those who understand scaling a print. I'll update this review later as I'm now very comfortable to use it for some tricky prints coming up. When will you sell HIPS? If anything like this, you'll be our main supplier!
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE CHAFFINS

customer_reviews.title: Great abs filament!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this filament because of the price, but I’ll be buying more. It took me a little bit, but I got great results. With bed temp of 95c, end temp 240c, and upping my flow % to 105 got some great parts! I used another brand before that had great reviews, but it came in wet, and was difficult to print. I also tried vapor smoothing this and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: ZDouglas

customer_reviews.title: Very picky about settings compared to other ABS I've used.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bad review of IC3D's products in general, I really like their stuff. This particular spool (my first in the blue ABS) has been VERY picky about temperatures, and wouldn't adhere to my printbed (kapton-covered) at less than 145C. Similarly, the hotend needed to be 245C to get good printing. It may be the batch that I got a spool from, or just the dark pigment causing the difference in behavior over IC3D's usually outstanding filament. I've bought and used their natural, silver, and gold colors with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tugboat

customer_reviews.title: Best Filament So Far - Great Company
customer_reviews.text: I own a small business in which I use my printer non-stop ([...]). I have put over 1200 hours on my flashforge creator and during that time I have tried numerous brands of plastic (Filaco, makerbot, Zentoolworks, Flashforge). I have had no negative issues with this plastic and its price is excellent. I spoke on the phone with the owner for a short time, and he helped me find a part for my printer that I was struggling with. I only buy IC3D filament now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good filament! Please add a scale to the spool showing how much filament is left... in pounds.
customer_reviews.text: Hey IC3D, great filament! Here is a suggestion: Talk to your spool manufacturer (injection molder) and have a scale added to the inside of the spool showing how many pounds of plastic in 0.1 or 0.2 pound increments are left on the spool. We don't expect it to be spot on, but a good visual guide to say, "Whoops, I'll need a new spool for the next big print." Error on the safe side just a bit, and we'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Product Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: N=1, but this was a great roll for me. I'm purchasing a second as we speak.
customer_reviews.text: I've had bad rolls of other filaments. This guy stayed in calibration over the course of the 800g I've printed so far. Lovely and smooth. I'm not certain if it's true "natural" or if it's slightly dyed natural. To be honest I believe it is natural ABS with a white colourant, but not a very strong one. In the past the pure 100% undyed ABS i've used has not been this white. It can be a plus for most people, but something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: More of an off white
customer_reviews.text: Prints beautifully, and adheres to the bed very well. Tolerances are excellent too. Only complaint is the beige is more of an off white, only the slightest hint of beige to it. But otherwise excellent filament. Cost a bit more than other brands but well worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Severin Zaluzec

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the first time.
customer_reviews.text: (Edit) I was promptly contacted my the manufacturer and shipped a new roll. It is as good as the first roll I bought from them. They have renewed my faith as a customer. Thank-you. This is the second time I have purchased your filament. This batch seems to have been very bad. After multiple failed prints due to head jams I ran my fingers along a length and could feel the change in diameter. Be advised.
customer_reviews.author: josh j

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty new to ABS printing but to me this stuff ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the closest thing to "Prusa Orange" that I have been able to find. Slightly darker but not enough to tell unless your specifically comparing part color. As far as printing, I'm pretty new to ABS printing but to me this stuff is a dream. Hardly any odor (honestly I can't smell it and my wife can't either with it printing). Parts come out beautifully and I've had no issues with adhesion to my PEI bed or any extruder issues. I've been through two rolls of orange, a roll of black and a half a roll of natural. All exactly the same quality. Highly recommend this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't arrive vacuum sealed
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with scrathes in the vacuum sealed back, which meant it wasn't actually sealed. Gonna leave it in the drybox for today, I'll change the rating once I see the results. Supposedly it's really high quality so let's hope this little (albeit important) detail won't affect that much the product.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: The best yet!
customer_reviews.text: Print Quality: This plastic has been the best I have ever run in my machine. I have had plastic from all the major sources and this one easily tops them all. Presentation: Most suppliers just throw their plastic in a bag, but this came in a heavy duty bag with dessicant, and the bag was packed inside a very nice box which had the company logo and a nice sticker for my machine. This is above and beyond my experience with other plastic suppliers.
customer_reviews.author: Draggon

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading reviews, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this filament. Have tried several brands and types of filament, and this is one of my favorites. It's slightly translucent, but not enough to obscure details (most translucent filaments make it almost impossible to photograph prints because all the detail is lost in the light scattering). This filament is juuuust translucent enough to hide the layer lines really well, but doesn't take anything away from detailed prints. :) Fantastic stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic filament.  My new goto brand for ABS.
customer_reviews.text: This filament is just about perfect. I've used it on a Printrbot Simple Metal with heated bed and a Rostock Max V2 and have had great results with both. No clogs whatsoever and the prints come out very strong and very aesthetically pleasing. The spool is very sturdy and the packaging leaves nothing to be desired. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lonie

customer_reviews.title: but prints fine at 250C
customer_reviews.text: Clogs at 230C, but prints fine at 250C. This stuff flows may smoother than Hatchbox ABS, but being higher temp it also tends to delaminate easier unless you use a heated enclosure. I've had some of my best looking ABS prints with this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: "strongshock"

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap this stuff is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolute BEST quality ABS I have ever used. Made in USA, this is a strong and well regulated product. Absolutely the best 1.75mm ABS filament you're going to find. Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: D Woodie

customer_reviews.title: Very very red
customer_reviews.text: I've heard others have had a hard time finding a good red. I highly recommend this stuff. It's red, it's opaque, and it's glossy. Prints beautifully at 240°C with a bed temperature of 50°C and an extrusion multiplier (in Slic3r terms) of 93%. Perfect for printing handles and knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: ... of IC3D material and I find it is as excellent as the first one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second roll of IC3D material and I find it is as excellent as the first one. My first roll is black and I have had it for about 18 months and it still works like it did when it was new. I use it on an UP Plus2 with an Octave Multi Temp Switch. The parts I make have been mostly working prototypes for medical devices. The precision had been very good and I can even make parts with working threads. If you need quality material for your 3D printer this brand works very well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Poor Thermal and Strength Properties
customer_reviews.text: This filament exhibited extremely undesirable thermal properties in a FlashForge Creator Pro with heated bed to 110 C and printhead between 220-230 C. The plastic showed poor cohesion to the glass heated bed with Kapton, frequent delaminations between layers, and generally horrible strength properties. All around this was a very frustrating plastic to work with, especially considering the price and other rave reviews. It is the lowest quality filament above $20/kg that I have personally purchased and 0.9 kg of it will go unused.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great Plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I have used more than 30 rolls from this vendor. The plastic is always consistent and plays well with my machines. This works great in the Flashforge Pro (better than what comes with the printer) and my modded XYZ. I have had less than 3% of the rolls I order have print issues however with the quantity I use I feel this is acceptable. I will continue to purchase this product. Thank you Ic3D!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yingling

customer_reviews.title: So far IC3D has been the best filament I have found for my Solidoodle 3
customer_reviews.text: So far IC3D has been the best filament I have found for my Solidoodle 3, but very disappointed in a white spool I received. Constantly tangles and ruins my prints. I have to baby sit prints. Every so often it will seem as the its wound over itself like its stuck under one or two layers. Other than this roll this filament has been great.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color and filament!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write a lot of reviews... but I had to come back and post one for this filament.. not only is it one of the nicest greens I have seen, but it prints incredibly fluid and smooth... I highly recommend it! i found 222c and bed at 80c was absolutely perfect...
customer_reviews.author: Matty D

customer_reviews.title: Great, my standard.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other brands and this stuff i come back to every time. Runs 220c on a custom stainless hotend. If you see warp with this stuff with bigger pieces try to LOWER your bed temp. I know it sounds stupid, but it works. Very close tolerance to 1.75.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fouke

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Got about 10 different types of ABS, and this is hands-down the best product on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Scott F.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's worth it!  A superior product,
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. This is a real good filament and I really am glad I spent the extra money to buy it. ABS is hard enough to print but this manufacturer did an excellent job with this product. My prints look real good and I have regained my faith in ABS prints. IC3D is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: BEST 3D stuff on the Planet!!
customer_reviews.text: This ABS is AWESOME!! Prints flat, sticks great to Kapton tape with some Cube glue or Rave hair spray...so well that I have a hard time getting it off the printer bed. I use IC3D Kapton, I use a new piece each time as it is SO inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: KWICK Aronson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product received
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1.75mm filament and received the box in my picture that shows 1.75mm filament. When I opened the box, it contained a spool of filament that is 2.9mm (3mm) in diameter. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It also helped me prove that my Davinci printer is a very good one, given filament that is clean and properly ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit more expensive than other brands, but I put it squarely in the "you get what you pay for" category. Improved my print quality more than I would have thought possible. It also helped me prove that my Davinci printer is a very good one, given filament that is clean and properly blended.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Engineer

customer_reviews.title: crappy Chinese filament to this resulted in much better print ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality filament that has never caused a failed print to this point -- switching from cheap, crappy Chinese filament to this resulted in much better print quality. Best filament value to be had in the 3D printing space.
customer_reviews.author: BlendDoor_com

customer_reviews.title: Am getting excellent results
customer_reviews.text: Using IC3D 1.75mm 2lb ABS red on my Flashforge and am getting very good result. Extrusion is smooth and consistent, the red color is bright, and am getting no curling. (using hotbed = 110C and hotend = 230C). I had similar good results with their dark blue filament.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Joe

customer_reviews.title: If your going to print in ABS this is a great standard filament to use
customer_reviews.text: This really prints well on my rostock max V2, makes parts stronger and more flexible than the $40k stratysis printer at my work and was cheap. Didn't have any issues with it jamming or anything. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Black color looks great. Prints fine at 230C
customer_reviews.text: Consistent and clean filament. Black color looks great. Prints fine at 230C, used most of it to print out pieces for a RepRap they parts looks nice. The price, quality, and with Amazon prime I will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell J Cerroni

customer_reviews.title: Superior product!
customer_reviews.text: Superior product! Always sticks to heated bed, consistent filament structure and color. Excellent at 230 C. Prefer this over many other filament brands.
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, that is to make good 3D prints. Only issue is slight warping of the edges during printing, and the price is a bit high. Maybe $29.99 is a more reasonable price...
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Gibson

customer_reviews.title: layer adhesion is perfect, filament is a constant size
customer_reviews.text: IC3D is one of my go-to brands. It costs a bit more than some of the other brands available, but for $5 extra I never have any headaches, layer adhesion is perfect, filament is a constant size, and it's incredibly easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Roy H.

customer_reviews.title: This filament works really well with my MakerGear M2 printer.
customer_reviews.text: This filament works really well with my MakerGear M2 printer. Using this on a new custom drone project and the strength and finish is very good. No jams either, flows just great. Very happy thank you IC3D!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Strong filament.
customer_reviews.text: This filament is really, really strong. It makes it a bit hard to remove the rafts and supports and a teeny bit harder to take out of the holes of our Up! Mini platform, but it is very good at holding together, and it looks really good.
customer_reviews.author: A reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best Filament you can get
customer_reviews.text: We bought 12 ABS rolls from IC3D, all of them worked great and loked great in the end. This is the best filament you can get right now a new Standard for filament filament makers.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Best filament I have tried...
customer_reviews.text: Best filament I have tried yet. The filament that came with my printer was hideous; all kinds of contaminants, bubbles and such. I could hardly believe how smooth and even the prints were from this product. Awesome product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Chief Engineer

customer_reviews.title: New convert from Makerbot brand filament.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time of using the IC3D brand and I have been pleasantly surprised. I have always used Makerbot filament but the price has not kept up with competition (never has gone down). So I decided to try the IC3D brand after reading other reviews. Never jammed, flowed well and didn't smell much (as compared to Makerbot). I will definitely be buying this brand again (actually this is my second order because I used up 2 spools of this same color already).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice filament and color
customer_reviews.text: Excellent RED. I've had a hard time finding a true red, something not orange-ish. This fits the bill, and I've always been happy with IC3D
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Works good but wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Prints fine the only issue is I ordered red and I recieved white not sure what happend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONLY white ABS filament you should ever buy
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many others, and this is the ONLY one that is truly white...all the others have a milky, yellowish tint. This is really white-white. Stop looking, don't look to save a few bucks. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Futches

customer_reviews.title: Quality filament.
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I expected and then some. Standard ABS filament. Excellent tolerances 1.76mm +- 0.01mm Packaged with descant. Filament and completed parts are more durable then expected. Much better than so many other competitors
customer_reviews.author: Dood Guy McPants

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Spot on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it has a good review, and was very inexpensive. It arrived well packaged, and printed outstanding. No issues whatsoever. It's made in the USA, and is a great price. I'll be ordering 1 of each color for my bench stock. Keep it up.
customer_reviews.author: Steev

customer_reviews.title: Love the support
customer_reviews.text: Long story short. I had some variation in filament diameter which created a jam. These folks reached out to discuss the problem then sent me a replacement spool which is printing wonderfully. All my prints prior to the jam came out great and everything since has been great as well. I really like this filament and the company that stands behind it.
customer_reviews.author: pyromancer

customer_reviews.title: Great Filament for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first spool of this particular filament and I am extremely happy with it. The dimensional qualities were good and the prints from it are quite good. This may be my Company of choice for filament if they can keep a good stock of it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Eaglezsoar

customer_reviews.title: Good Filament
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is a stable ABS filament. Have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D.N.

customer_reviews.title: Great ABS filament.
customer_reviews.text: This filament was recommended to me from a friend when I was having issues with bubbles in the stock filament that came with my printer. Since I started purchasing IC3D ABS, I have yet to have any bubbles or filament-related issues in any of my prints 6 spools later. It is a little pricier than other ABS filaments I have seen, but so far I say it's worth the extra little investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filament
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent filament, and worked flawlessly every time I ran prints with normal ABS temperature settings and typical printing profiles. I would highly recommend this filament to those that are shopping, and I will continue to source from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Just started out 3D printing, got 2 rolls from other company's and was ripping my hair out why I got nothing but jamming. After a few months I decided to give it another try again, got this filament and everything is working great! I NEVER post reviews but I just could not be happier with this filament. Going to purchase some color ones tonight now. IF YOU ARE NEW LIKE ME, GET THIS ONE!!! , or if you just want something that simply works.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Filament!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE best filament on the market! It extrudes without bubbles and creates perfect prints. It's the only filament that I will buy! Printing on an old Solidoodle 2 with heated bed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jones

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC ABS
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best ABS I've used. Parts are smoother and more durable than some of the ABS plastics I've used in the past. This is the only plastic I'll be using from here on. Using on the Flashforge Creator with 0.4 mm tip. I have purchased natural and black with incredible results. Buy this plastic you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Bakken

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best ABS I've used. Parts are smoother and more durable than some of the ABS plastics I've used in the past. This is the only plastic I'll be using from here on. Using on the Flashforge Creator with 0.4 mm tip. I have purchased natural and black with incredible results. Buy this plastic you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Bakken

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Product performed as expected. I ran into a problem about a 1/3 of the way down the roll. My hot end clogged and even raising the temp to 270C didn't do anything. I had to take the hot end apart to fix the problem. Other than that it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Magneato70

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Second time I've ordered this. The first was the best filament I've ever used. Adheres to the pyrex perfectly, pulls off the reel smoothly without any binding.
customer_reviews.author: Dahaka

customer_reviews.title: Working on spool #2
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting the second spool, 3 total. This filament prints very very nicely. No problems with the filament being wound funky like on other spools I've had. Color is very consistent.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Have used it in both the Oni H Bot and the Ultimaker 2 with great success. Fast shipping too
customer_reviews.text: Have gotten exceptional prints with IC3D ABS filament! Have used it in both the Oni H Bot and the Ultimaker 2 with great success. Fast shipping too!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kay

customer_reviews.title: Nice Filament, Great Service
customer_reviews.text: This filament is a good one, I measured it and it kept within the tolerance specified. Print very nice and with no problem. It is only par with the follow up of the people in the company, willing to make it right. I will keep buying this filament.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: The best filament you can get
customer_reviews.text: We bought 12 ABS rolls from IC3D, all of them worked great and loked great in the end. This is the best filament you can get right now, a new Standard for filament makers.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D filament!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this natural filament from IC3D it prints great, already using my tenth roll of it. Very pleased with the quality!
customer_reviews.author: shoeffeine

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great Filament. Prints consistently, sticks to the build plate well, good color. (It's a bit darker orange than most other filaments) Will be buying much more of this in the future. Printing great on my Up! Plus at 220c and 0.25mm layer height.
customer_reviews.author: Naxster

customer_reviews.title: the filament just keeps cracking in every print.. ...
customer_reviews.text: *update. Someone at ic3d contacted me and gave some suggestions on how to fix the cracking issues all I did was increase the hotend temp to 260c and the cracking seemed to go away the filament just keeps cracking in every print..ive used other abs filaments before and they would crack but only if it was a big print, but with this filament, the prints fail no matter how big they are
customer_reviews.author: Bluexorcist

customer_reviews.title: This has been great filament. Great consistency, easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: This has been great filament. Great consistency, easy to work with. No complaints. This will be my goto ABS for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Foxglove

customer_reviews.title: The orange color from IC3D is great. It comes out clean and doesn't leave a ...
customer_reviews.text: The orange color from IC3D is great. It comes out clean and doesn't leave a residue like some other filaments I've tired. I would like to see the packaging changed to include a "zip lock" style bag to prevent moisture from accumulating. This would help to ensure the filament was consistently high quality as it was used.
customer_reviews.author: LuvzToBuy

customer_reviews.title: Company prints own filament - Quality - Beautiful color - prompt shipping A+
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bright red color and quality filament from a company that makes their own filament and ships promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kay

customer_reviews.title: Package was opened
customer_reviews.text: The spool seems to be intact but missing dry pack and seem a tad less than the other spool - wondering if it has been used and returned and resold
customer_reviews.author: Xam

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I've been printing since November and this is by far the best ABS filament I've used so far. I've tried a few brands (eBay, Hatchbox, Maker's tool works, Proto paradigm) and IC3D has the best filament tolerances, print finish and material strength. IC3D will definitely be my go to for filament in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Material.
customer_reviews.text: Great product made in U.S.A. Price a bit high compared to others of similar class, but I guess that is fair price for quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: ... thought nature means white because of the picture very bad although I bought from this company many times but ...
customer_reviews.text: it is so confusing that picture does not match product where in picture it is white while actual it is transparent I thought nature means white because of the picture very bad although I bought from this company many times but this time it's not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Asim

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy some
customer_reviews.text: Great filament and price is excellent. Prints perfect. Packaging is nice. No popping when printing. Best of all it's made here in the USA. I'm placing another order for more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ABS out there that i've used by far.
customer_reviews.text: Just pulled out the first object made from this, and WOW. The object is the firmest and best quality i've ever printed before. I am sticking to this brand of filament for sure. I didn't even know my printer could print this well. I wish I could trade my other 9 spools for a bunch of these because I don't even want to use the other stuff anymore when I can print this well with IC3D.
customer_reviews.author: Cf

customer_reviews.title: It works for me
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the only filament that has worked well with my Robo-3 3D printer. High quality! Below are several Settlers of Catan tiles and pieces I printed.
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Great Filament!
customer_reviews.text: I have used two different spools of hatchbox filament before this and can say that this filament is MUCH better. I thought my printer had issues until I used this filament, now my prints turn out flawlessly. If you are considering it then get this filament.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Best ABS
customer_reviews.text: Best ABS there is, period. Color is great, and prints turn out Awesome, also the price is right and comes with a cool IC3D Sticker!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.text: Best ABS there is, period. Color is great, and prints turn out Awesome, also the price is right and comes with a cool IC3D Sticker!

customer_reviews.title: It works great and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is great, i have not had any clogs while using it. It is a nice ivory white. I use it on my MakerGear M2 without any problems!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Consistency
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 3D printer for about a year now and have tried several different materials and so far this is the best. The consistency of the quality is what is the major factor here. I like this material so much that I started purchasing it for my company as well as my personal use.

customer_reviews.title: Best filament by far
customer_reviews.text: Best filament by far. I continue to use this product because I know I will have constant prints every time. Also it gives me great pride to be supporting American jobs
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Filament. Works great and comes well packaged. Also includes a nice IC3D sticker :)
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Nothings worse than dirty filament. This stuff is packaged to keep it clean. The box can be reused for storage and it has a cutout on one end so you can see what color it is. Very consistent diameter and roundness so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peters

customer_reviews.title: I bought five spools of the ABS filament and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought five spools of the ABS filament and I have had exceptional results. I use this on a RoBo 3D and on an Ultimaker 2. I use IC3D filament exclusively now. You can't go wrong with made in the USA.

product_meta.title: IC3D Red 1.75mm ABS 3D Printer Filament - 1kg Spool - Dimensional Accuracy +/- 0.05mm - Professional Grade 3D Printing Filament - Made in USA
product_meta.description: Size:1 kg| Color:redIC3D - For 3D Printers, By 3D Printers (TM) Spend more time printing with high-quality 3D printer filament from IC3D. IC3D extrudes 3D printer filament in-house in Ohio, USA. Strict production standards for cleanliness and tolerance specifications ensure the diameter is within +/- 0.05mm and ovality (roundness) is within 4%. Quality is the top priority as each spool is hand checked, vacuum sealed with desiccant, and packaged. IC3D filament is extensively tested with success on a variety of mainstream desktop 3D printers utilizing various extruder designs and hot-end styles. Every spool of IC3D filament is backed by a 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE.
feature_bullets: Filament diameter is 1.75mm +/-0.05, ovality (roundness) is within 4% and weight is 2.1lb +/- 0.1
Made in the USA under strict quality standards

Compatible with the following 3D printers (with heated beds): Reprap, Afinia, MakerBot, PrintrBot, UltiMaker, Airwolf, Makergear, Up!, Lulzbot, Flashforge, Solidoodle, 3doodler (pen), Delta, Mbot, Type A

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars191 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
